com.pi4j.jni

Class I2C

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pi4j.jni.I2C

  • public class I2C
extends Object

    I2C Communication

    Set of native methods for interacting with i2c bus on RPi.

    Note: The file descriptor (fd) returned is a standard Linux filehandle. You can use the standard read(), write(), etc. system calls on this filehandle as required.

    Author:
    Daniel Sendula

    • Method Detail

      • i2cOpen

        public static int i2cOpen(String device)
        Opens linux file for r/w returning file handle.
        Parameters:
        device - file name of device. For i2c should be /dev/i2c-0 or /dev/i2c-1 for first or second bus.
        Returns:
        file descriptor or i2c bus.

      • i2cClose

        public static int i2cClose(int fd)
        Closes linux file.
        Parameters:
        fd - file descriptor

      • i2cWriteByteDirect

        public static int i2cWriteByteDirect(int fd,
                                     int deviceAddress,
                                     byte data)
        Writes one byte to i2c. It uses ioctl to define device address and then writes one byte.
        Parameters:
        fd - file descriptor of i2c bus
        deviceAddress - device address
        data - byte to be written to the device
        Returns:
        result of operation. Zero if everything is OK, less than zero if there was an error.

      • i2cWriteBytesDirect

        public static int i2cWriteBytesDirect(int fd,
                                      int deviceAddress,
                                      int size,
                                      int offset,
                                      byte[] buffer)
        Writes several bytes to i2c. It uses ioctl to define device address and then writes number of bytes defined in size argument.
        Parameters:
        fd - file descriptor of i2c bus
        deviceAddress - device address
        size - number of bytes to be written
        offset - offset in buffer to read from
        buffer - data buffer to be written
        Returns:
        result of operation. Zero if everything is OK, less than zero if there was an error.

      • i2cWriteByte

        public static int i2cWriteByte(int fd,
                               int deviceAddress,
                               int localAddress,
                               byte data)
        Writes one byte to i2c. It uses ioctl to define device address and then writes two bytes: address in the device itself and value.
        Parameters:
        fd - file descriptor of i2c bus
        deviceAddress - device address
        localAddress - address in the device
        data - byte to be written to the device
        Returns:
        result of operation. Zero if everything is OK, less than zero if there was an error.

      • i2cWriteBytes

        public static int i2cWriteBytes(int fd,
                                int deviceAddress,
                                int localAddress,
                                int size,
                                int offset,
                                byte[] buffer)
        Writes several bytes to i2c. It uses ioctl to define device address and then writes number of bytes defined in size argument plus one.
        Parameters:
        fd - file descriptor of i2c bus
        deviceAddress - device address
        localAddress - address in the device
        size - number of bytes to be written
        offset - offset in buffer to read from
        buffer - data buffer to be written
        Returns:
        result of operation. Zero if everything is OK, less than zero if there was an error.

      • i2cReadByteDirect

        public static int i2cReadByteDirect(int fd,
                                    int deviceAddress)
        Reads one byte from i2c device. It uses ioctl to define device address and then reads one byte.
        Parameters:
        fd - file descriptor of i2c bus
        deviceAddress - device address
        Returns:
        positive number (or zero) to 255 if read was successful. Negative number if reading failed.

      • i2cReadBytesDirect

        public static int i2cReadBytesDirect(int fd,
                                     int deviceAddress,
                                     int size,
                                     int offset,
                                     byte[] buffer)
        Reads more bytes from i2c device. It uses ioctl to define device address and then reads size number of bytes.
        Parameters:
        fd - file descriptor of i2c bus
        deviceAddress - device address
        size - number of bytes to be read
        offset - offset in buffer to stored read data
        buffer - buffer for data to be written to
        Returns:
        number of bytes read or negative number if reading failed.

      • i2cReadByte

        public static int i2cReadByte(int fd,
                              int deviceAddress,
                              int localAddress)
        Reads one byte from i2c device. It uses ioctl to define device address, writes addres in device and then reads one byte.
        Parameters:
        fd - file descriptor of i2c bus
        deviceAddress - device address
        localAddress - address in the device
        Returns:
        positive number (or zero) to 255 if read was successful. Negative number if reading failed.

      • i2cReadBytes

        public static int i2cReadBytes(int fd,
                               int deviceAddress,
                               int localAddress,
                               int size,
                               int offset,
                               byte[] buffer)
        Reads more bytes from i2c device. It uses ioctl to define device address, writes addres in device and then reads size number of bytes.
        Parameters:
        fd - file descriptor of i2c bus
        deviceAddress - device address
        localAddress - address in the device
        size - number of bytes to be read
        offset - offset in buffer to stored read data
        buffer - buffer for data to be written to
        Returns:
        number of bytes read or negative number if reading failed.

      • i2cWriteAndReadBytes

        public static int i2cWriteAndReadBytes(int fd,
                                       int deviceAddress,
                                       int writeSize,
                                       int writeOffset,
                                       byte[] writeBuffer,
                                       int readSize,
                                       int readOffset,
                                       byte[] readBuffer)
        Reads more bytes from i2c device. It uses ioctl to define device address, writes addres in device and then reads size number of bytes.
        Parameters:
        fd - file descriptor of i2c bus
        deviceAddress - device address
        writeSize - number of bytes to write
        writeOffset - offset in write buffer to start write data
        writeBuffer - buffer for data to be written from
        readSize - number of bytes to be read
        readOffset - offset in read buffer to stored read data
        readBuffer - buffer for data read to be stored in
        Returns:
        number of bytes read or negative number if reading failed.
